title: Understanding the Graph
text: For a quadratic function in the form $${ax}^2+bx+c$$, the graph is a parabola. Parabolas either open upwards or downwards. Can you recall how the sign of 'a' affects this?

title: Identify 'a' in the Function
text: What is the value of 'a' in the equation $$y(x)=2x^2-10x+4$$? Based on this, does the parabola open upwards or downwards?

title: Determine Minimum or Maximum
text: If a parabola opens upwards, does it have a minimum point or a maximum point?

title: Find the Axis of Symmetry
text: The axis of symmetry for a quadratic function in the form of $${ax}^2+bx+c$$ can be calculated using $$x=\frac{-b}{2a}$$. Substitute the values of 'b' and 'a' from $$y(x)=2x^2-10x+4$$ into this formula.

title: Calculate the Minimum Value
text: To find the minimum value of the function, substitute the x-coordinate of the axis of symmetry into the original equation $$y(x)=2x^2-10x+4$$.
